SENT.plain: Among 250 patients with Behcet's disease, we describe 25 cases of angiographically proven cerebral venous thrombosis
Intracranial hypertension was the most frequent manifestation
Treatment of cerebral venous thrombosis consisted of combined heparin and steroids in 19 patients, steroids alone in three, and heparin alone in three others
Neurologic symptoms improved rapidly in all
Nineteen patients received long-term anticoagulation, and two received aspirin
Relapse of cerebral venous thrombosis or development of optic atrophy did not occur in treated patients
Partial or total recanalization of the occluded sinus was frequent
After more than 3 years of follow-up, the prognosis of dural sinus thrombosis is satisfactory
